intro: Horkelia utahensis, commonly known as Utah horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments, such as Utah's desert regions. It has a low-growing habit and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Horkelia utahensis is adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions with minimal water availability.
